meta.name: Clean Neutral SaaS Light UI
meta.source: Extracted from provided screenshot (component gallery style)
meta.purpose: High-level design system spec to let AI replicate the look consistently across the app.
meta.scope: Light mode only. Component-level guidelines and tokens; not implementation code.

overall: Prioritize clarity and legibility over decoration.
Use whitespace and alignment to create structure; avoid heavy ornament.
Use soft elevation and rounded corners to communicate interactivity.
Reserve saturated color for emphasis and state—most UI stays neutral.
Design for long sessions: low visual noise, predictable hierarchy.

visualStyle.surfaceLanguage: Predominantly white with subtle tinted surfaces; cards float slightly above background using soft shadow + light border.
visualStyle.cornerPhilosophy: Rounded corners everywhere, consistent radii; small elements use pills.
visualStyle.shadowPhilosophy: Shadows are soft, wide, and low-contrast (no harsh drop shadows).
visualStyle.borderPhilosophy: Thin, light borders used for structure; borders rarely exceed 1px.

interaction.hover: If on web, hover slightly increases elevation and border contrast; no color flashing.
interaction.pressed: Pressed state slightly darkens background and compresses elevation by 1 level.
interaction.focus: Accessible focus ring using primary brand color at low alpha; 2–3px ring with offset.

contentFirstRules: Text content gets priority in spacing and contrast.
Metadata (timestamps, counts, status) is smaller and lighter, never competing with titles.
Actions are grouped and visually separated from content blocks.

density.compact: reduce vertical padding by 25% while maintaining tap targets

fontFamily.primary: System UI / SF Pro / Inter (fallback to system)

rules: Use strong weight for titles and CTAs; keep body text regular for readability.
Avoid large blocks of ALL CAPS; use sentence case for approachability.
Use tabular numbers for counters and metrics where possible.
Default UI uses neutrals; brand color is used for primary actions and selected states.
Semantic colors are used for status chips, alerts, and feedback; keep them low-saturation in background form.
Avoid using pure black for large filled surfaces; keep black for text emphasis only.
Maintain WCAG contrast: text on white should be near-black; muted text remains readable.

icons.trailingIcon: Allowed; avoid both leading and trailing unless necessary

rules: Primary buttons are used for the single highest-intent action in a context.
Keep multiple primary buttons on a screen to a minimum; prefer secondary/ghost for alternatives.
Buttons have consistent corner radius and no heavy shadows; rely on color and subtle elevation.
Chips are low-emphasis; never compete with titles.
Use semantic colors for status, not decoration.
Avoid long chip text; truncate or wrap in tooltips if needed.

header.actions: Top-right actions are small/ghost buttons or icon buttons

rules: Cards group related information; avoid nested cards deeper than 2 levels.
Prefer dividers and spacing over heavy outlines.
Clickable cards should show hover/pressed feedback via elevation and subtle border change.
List items use consistent left alignment for avatar/title/meta.
Secondary columns (counts/status) align to the right and are visually lighter.
Use dividers sparingly; prefer card separation when possible.
Inputs should feel light and tidy; avoid thick borders.
Focus ring uses brand color at low alpha.
Error state uses semantic danger border + helper text; avoid large red fills.

sideNav.selectedIndicator: Left bar or subtle bg tint

emptyStates.illustrationStyle: light, outline, low-contrast; friendly but not childish
emptyStates.cta: Use a single primary button, centered

rules: Alerts use tinted backgrounds, not saturated fills.
Keep alert copy short; provide clear next action if needed.

icons.style: simple, rounded, consistent stroke width; minimal detail
icons.coloredIcons: Use only for semantic meaning or app illustration blocks; keep most icons neutral.

guidelines: Use short labels for buttons (1–2 words).
Use sentence case for most UI text.
Avoid overly playful slang; keep it modern and stable.

doNotDo: Do not use harsh shadows or strong gradients as primary decoration.
Do not mix many saturated colors on one screen; keep brand + one semantic color if needed.
Do not use heavy borders or outlines everywhere—use whitespace first.
Do not create inconsistent corner radii across components.
